0.text: Bug 16777  Busy cursor lost over progress indicator edges.

1.text: Whenever BusyIndicator.showWhile() is used around a ProgressMonitorDialog,  there are 1 pixel borders around the progress indicator that retain the default  cursor.

2.text: The busy cursor should be active for the entire ProgressMonitorDialog.

3.text: To reproduce: 1) Check something out of CVS that will take around 10 seconds.

4.text: 2) While the operation is in progress, mouse over the busy indicator.

5.text: 3) Depending on how fast you moved the cursor, you will see the cursor flash  over the borders of the busy indicator.

6.text: If you stop the cursor on the correct  pixel, the busy cursor changes back to the normal cursor.

7.text: This behaviour was observed in F1 on Windows.

8.text: Linux-Motif does not exhibit this  behaviour.
